alert.note: Alert for Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 11:02PM MDT until further notice by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wyoming, including the following county, Crook. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1059 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Creek, Alum Creek, Lame Jones Creek, Deep Creek, Horse Creek, Pine Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Gumbo Creek, Arnold Creek, Bear Gulch and Oak Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Crook County north of Alva and Aladdin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
